headline: Simple Hamburger Stroganoff
description: This easy hamburger stroganoff is just as tasty as if it were made with a more expensive cut of beef, but it's much friendlier on your wallet.

video.description: A meaty, creamy, pasta dish with mushrooms.
video.name: Simple Hamburger Stroganoff

name: Simple Hamburger Stroganoff
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into pieces
1 (6 ounce) can chopped mushrooms, with liquid
1 (.75 ounce) packet dry brown gravy mix
2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rapid boil. Cook egg noodles at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, 7 to 9 minutes. Drain.

At the same time, cook ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Stir in cream cheese, mushrooms with liquid, and gravy mix; cook and stir over medium heat until cream cheese melts, 2 to 3 minutes. Add condensed soup, sour cream, and milk; cook, stirring occasionally, until smooth and creamy, 3 to 5 minutes.
Drain egg noodles; stir into the beef mixture. Cook until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Thank you for sharing! This was really good. I thought two cans of soup is a little much so I used 1.25 cans. It’s very creamy almost too creamy probably need to cut a little of cheese and cream but very delicious.

Very forgiving recipe. Used what I had on hand. 1 packet of brown gravy mix, 1 can of cream of chicken/mushroom. Half a soup can of whole milk. Halved the cream cheese and used a generous dollop of sour cream. Sautéed 1/2 an onion and 1 tsp minced garlic once the meat was mostly cooked. The tiny onion bits still had a little crunch. Added super delicious texture and taste. Didn’t have any mushrooms on hand and only 12 oz bag of noodles. Turned out great. Picky teenager even loved it.
This is a great comfort dish. It is easy to make and has a fantastic blend of flavors.

This was very simple and delicious! Of course like all internet recipes I didnt have all ingredients so no sour cream extra milk and a little butter, added a dash of cayenne pepper and used elk hamburger meat. But all n all ... took about a minute to make a happy plate! Thanks for making me unafraid of making this dish it's now a top fav!!
This really was delicious and very easy to make - I’m excited for the leftovers!

Will be making this again! It makes a lot. I was surprised how flavorful it was since there were no added seasonings. My 6 year old grandson had 2 helpings! That’s a huge success. He is a very picky eater.

Make sure you have an xtra large pan for all ingredients. It makes a large amount. I used 12oz Egg noodles ( should have used the 16oz), added a can of sweet peas, and sauté baby bells in place of canned mushrooms. Also added a bit of beef bullion powder to hamburger. Great move. Excellent dish. Added a bit more garlic to taste.
Very good. I subbed 2 packets of au ju instead of brown gravy and used a little over a cup of milk because it was too think. But overall it was quite tasty.
Good recepie

This is really good. I added extra milk because I did not have sour cream, and i used tricolored rotini because Noone had any egg noodles(my favorite). I have never had "real" beef stroganoff but it's better than velveeta and mcCormick seasoning. I love it!!!!!!

I sauted onion and garlic before browning the meat. After reading other reviews,I used one can of soup and half of the cream cheese. Once the cream cheese was melted,I added the milk,sour cream and soup to the beef mixture.

I loved this recipe. It was very creamy and it made a huge amount. Lots of left overs to freeze. I did add 3 cloves garlic, salt and pepper to taste and fresh mushrooms along with the canned mushrooms, but other than that I followed the recipe.

I agree with the comments to use half of the sour cream, soup & cream cheese and to add onions, salt and pepper to taste. I also added half a pack of onion soup mix instead. Came out great. It’s a keeper.
Sooooooo good aaaand creamy
my comp said it was great, I thought it was alright. no complaints of the recipe though

I was kinda surprise at how bland this recipe was. It's probably the most bland meal I've ever had. However, perhaps it is common sense (I'm a newbie in the cooking world), but adding salt and pepper quickly turns this into maybe a 4 star. It amazes me how drastically it improves the taste.
This is a great base - great recipe and love the idea of adding cream cheese. I cut the milk in half though and didn't even add sour cream as it would have ended up too water. Family loved it !

A bit bland - also, too much sauce for the amount of meat. I live with a "carnivore" so if I make this again, I will add more meat and cut down soups and cream cheese. Honestly, I like the package sauce mixes for stroganoff better.

This was great. I used fresh mushrooms though and sautéed them with an added onion and some celery as I was cooking the meat. I added garlic powder, ground pepper and Worcestershire sauce, and threw in a couple eggs too. Best stroganoff ever!
It was good. I made it just as the recipe calls for but I added worcestershire sauce.
1/2 the soup, cream cheese, noodles and sour cream. Add onions and Worcestershire sauce. It was great

We liked it a lot. I took the advice of other reviewers and cut the soup and cream cheese by half. That was good advice.. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly. I will make it again for sure but may add some onion and garlic just to try it that way. Maybe a touch of wine.
I used a beef pot roast instead of ground beef and added garlic. Very delicious will make it again.

Tried as written the first time. Made some modifications the second time around. I sautéed onion and garlic with the hamburger, cut the amount of cream cheese to 4 oz, used 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1/2 soup can of milk and then a rather large dollop of sour cream and just added more to taste. Sprinkled liberally with s&p. The flavor was much richer without the extra cream cheese and soup. The flavor of the gravy mix comes through and it’s not as thick. Excellent quick recipe!

I made this stroganoff and it was very good. The bag of noodles was 12 oz. and I think it made the dish creamier. I used fresh mushrooms that I sauted with the hamburger. I rarely use canned mushrooms, but it's a personal preference. My husband also commented on how good it tasted.
It was TOO creamy for my liking. The taste was good, but it was more like noodle soup. I would definitely quadruple the noodles next time, but I doubt there will be a next time

Not a bad stroganoff at all. I followed others advise and split the soup, cream cheese and sour cream in 1/2, added garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper to taste. I also added 2/3 cup of water and let it simmer for about 20 minutes before serving. It was well received. Will definitely make this again.
I love this recipe! Quick and Easy!!! Lots of creamy sauce!!!
Made this for my family. The second time we had it on mashed potatoes. I used one can of soup and half cream cheese and half sour cream. Made just the right amount. Will make again soon.
Good the way it is. I will try adding some shaved Parmesan next time though.
Delicious. I used fresh mushrooms added more milk. Turned out really good.
Followed the recipe as is except I added some onions to it and it was wonderful- bursting with flavor!

I always had a fond memory of my mother making beef stroganoff and in my head, nothing could ever beat it...until this! I rarely write reviews but this one demanded one. Only change I made and it was by necessity not by choice was that I used one can cream of mushroom and one can golden mushroom. Because I didnt read far enough ahead, I cooked the noodles and sauce separately, plated noodles and spooned as much or little sauce on top. My husband and Mother in law could not stop raving about this meal. Both my children (P.I.my.A eaters) loved it.tgis will forever be our "go to." Thank you!!
if I were to make this again, I would half the cream cheese and sour cream, and add an extra package of brown gravy. wasn’t a fan and didn’t finish my plate.

It was eh, I followed the recipe and it was way too creamy and rich it overtook the whole meal. I would suggest to use way less of the cream cheese, sour cream and mushroom soup. Definitely has potential but wasn’t quite there with the amount of ingredients it suggests.
This dish was perfect. I changed the beef to chopped chicken because I don't eat beef but the recipe was spot on. Will be fixing again.

Made it twice so far. tasted a little flat first time. second time I added a Medium Yellow onion, diced small, four cloves minced garlic to the meat while cooking as well as fresh ground black pepper and salt to taste. I used whole milk, and Mushroom Gravy mix. Before combining with the noodles, I tasted and adjusted the seasoning. Second time it came out more like what I had expected the first attempt to be.Good Comfort Food

Loved this and was great to not need to turn on the oven during a humid day!
 Added a little bit if garlic powder, onion powder, and black pepper. 
 Used 4 oz. of light cream cheese instead of 8oz.
 Used dry mushroom gravy instead of brown gravy mix.
 Will look to make with 12ozs of noodles next time to cut down on how much this makes and keep it even creamier!
I don't drain my meat and cook fresh mushrooms with it. I season it with complete season and Everglades. Be ready for a nap after eating.
It was good

This is simple but uses WAY too much creamy stuff. Like other reviewers, one can back off the cream cheese by half, use one container cream of mushie soup and add sour cream to your taste by dropping into mixture in dollops. I could even go as far as saying the cream cheese isn’t necessary but it may add a thickness that flour, or, better yet, arrowroot powder would accomplish without all that heaviness. It’s a great baseline if you just back it off a little.

I made a few changes, as we always do! I made mini meatballs from 93% lean hamburger and cooked lightly (not too brown). I also used 1 can mushroom soup and 1 can cream of chicken soup (my husband's preference). It was super good!
So good and easy, will definately make again. Still cant believe how easy it was.
Make it often.

I read the reviews and followed some of the suggestions. I also added some chopped onion and garlic to the ground beef. I also used fresh mushrooms since I didn't have canned. I cut everything in half. Since there are only three of us I didn't want that much leftover. It was good. It may be better with some more seasoning.
I only used 1 can of soup and it was chicken because I was out of mushroom. I didn't measure the sour cream. It turned out great, but pretty thick. Not a bad thing. Everyone loved it!
This was super good! I originally didn’t see it called for 2 cans of soup....but it was fine with just one! I also used lo-fat cream cheese and lo-fat sour cream. We loved it!

Everyone in my family liked this - a 10 year old, SO and toddler. It was pretty easy but I did add onions and garlic to the meat as suggested by others and halved the cream cheese. I double everything, used fettuccini noodles (two 12 oz packages) and the ratio was nice. It was relatively thick so we added additional milk until it got to the consistency we wanted.

I used to 'throw something together' that was very similar to this. I called it Budget Stroganoff. I never wrote the recipe down, and I haven't made it in a very long time. This is very similar. The only difference that I make is adding bacon jam, which adds a nice bit of flavor. Thank you!
The only change I made was to add some hot italian sausage with the ground beef (I had to use it before it went bad). My husband was pleasantly surprised with the addition. Love this recipe!
This was delicious. My boyfriend and I both really liked it. Word of caution though, this makes a TON
The recipe came out pretty well. I only added one can of soup, and next time I would add less cream cheese. It could use a little seasoning as well. But overall pretty good and very easy to make.
Good. Probably not the healthiest. If I make it again, I think I’ll try 1 can of mushroom soup.
Was delicious i see people saying the taste suffered but thats what seasonings are for. I also put onions and garlic into the hamburger and it turned out great.
Great weeknight easy dinner. Its a keeper for our menu rotation
Made this several times. Excellent recipe.
so creamy and so good! this is my second time with it and just as good as the first!!

Easy!!! My husband and my boys loved it. It made enough for leftovers for two more nights ( blessing and a curse). I used farfalle noodles instead of egg noodles and added garlic salt to taste. The only thing I I’ll do differently next time is cook the mushrooms separately in the hamburger pan. They were a little under done because I didn’t want to overcook the hamburger. Quick and easy last minute dinner...tastes delicious too!!

This was good and easy. Only used half the cream cheese and cream of mushroom soup. Added chopped onion and minced garlic, 3TB Worcestershire, and 1ts Dijon mustard. Salt and pepper to taste. More milk if too thick. Will make again!
Love it! Made it exactly as the recipe calls for. My kids even loved it!
No mushrooms
Love this!! It was so good, I've been searching for a beef stroganoff recipe for a long time and happy to say this is the one for me!! Thank you, thank you!!

After reading a few of the other reviews I went ahead and did my own thing. I had just under a lb of ground beef and I found in my freezer about a 1/2 lb of mild Italian sausage so I defrosted that and added to the ground beef. Drained that. Added a small yellow onion, chopped and 2 cloves of minced garlic. Added some Worcestershire, maybe 2 tbsps. Salt & ground pepper. Let that simmer for about 10 min. Then added one can of beef broth and one can of cream of mushroom soup. Then a small can of drained mushroom pieces. (should've added anther can). Let that cook for about 15-20 min. Just before serving, I added about 1/2 sour cream and blended it into the meat mixture. Poured over wide egg noodles.
Absolutely amazing. Made it for a family when they needed some help when they got incredibly busy with sick family members. I tried a bit before sending it over and loved it, and they also loved it!
It was good. Tasted like eating pure cream cheese though.
Exactly as it reads- simple and easy. But those are the best comfort foods I am always looking for! Thank you.
Added an additional 1/2 cup of milk. Like it a little more liquid other than that was a great recipe
Family loved it! Can’t wait for me to make it again. I had 2lbs. of hamburger dethawing before I decided what to make so I just used all of it in the recipe and it still turned out great.
Awesome! I made it exactly as the recipe directs and it was a huge hit. I'll definitely be making this again!!!
Very good!
This is a good start, however, it needs a little more flavour.

Really easy and tasty! I did not add as much cream cheese, because we didn’t have enough on hand. I had to estimate the brown gravy mix, as we have a huge jar of that powder, so I just made two cups of that gravy pretty rich (since I doubled the recipe). 

Just needs a bit of salt, but left that people to add to their own portions. We served it with mixed veggies on the side, cinnamon apple sauce and some dinner rolls. Will make this again, surely!
Will definitely make this again. I used onion soup & dip mix instead of the brown gravy, and used fresh mushrooms. Hubby loved it! Next time I’ll add some onions as well.

This was a very easy dish to prepare and was quite tasty. I followed the suggestions I read in a few of the other reviews and cooked the ground beef with some onion and garlic, and I only used half of the block of cream cheese and one can on cream of mushroom soup. The consistency was good, without being too creamy.

Good with the following modifications: added sauted mushrooms and onions, used 1/2 the amount of cream cheese and sour cream, added about 8 ounces or so of beef broth, added salt, pepper and garlic powder.

Super simple recipe to throw together last minute. Makes a lot. I left the mushrooms out (picky eaters) Kind of like a home made version of hamburger helper out of the box . I was a little iffy when I added the cream cheese but it turned out great
Easy and delicious
Great as is
Delicious! Definitely adding to meal rotation. Everyone lived it
So great!!! Very delicious :) Quick and easy, very good alternative to beef stroganoff.
would use this again but without the cream cheese. made it way to heavy
The recipe came out great but i had to add a second gravy packet to give it a bit more flavor.

I didn't have ground beef so I sliced up some beef tips. I also read reviews and added (as one writer suggested) some Worcesteshire sauce. It came out great! Also, I only had one can of cream of mushroom soup. The sauce was perfect.
So so good...my husband loved it...next day i didnt even heat it up....just ate it cold.
yummy. picky family loved it.
It was amazing! Maybe use a little less sour cream because it dominated the flavor of the sauce
This turned out very creamy and delicious.
This was a GREAT weeknight quick meal... my grandson, who is a VERY picky eater gobbled it up! It will definitely be one of my "go-to" recipes when looking for something quick and easy.
Very good. The only thing I added was half of an onion, chopped. Everyone in the family really liked it. I’ll add this to our permanent rotation for sure!
Made it as is! So creamy and delicious.

This stroganoff was delicious! I made it for my parents and they both got second helpings. I will definitely make this again!
Changes: I cut the cream cheese in half to 4 oz like other reviews suggested, and I mixed in some garlic while cooking the hamburger.

I skipped the mushrooms altogether. I substituted cream of chicken and mushroom soup for the cream of mushroom soup.
I also substituted stew beef for turkey.

Next time I will add more milk to make up for the liquid loss from the mushrooms. It was super creamy and definitely ended up needing more milk added to the individual servings.

However the taste was great, easy to make and I will be making this again!
By far the easiest and tastiest stroganoff I have ever attempted,
Was good and easy. I always take a base recipes then add on.

This is so good and really easy to make.
My family loved it!
I might reduce soup & increase sour cream.
To much soup, definitely needed onion and garlic.
We loved it. A lot for just 2 people. I knew it was a rotation piece when he ate leftovers.
I made it with but added garlic to the hamburger and added cooked fresh mushrooms. Very good.
